name: International Emissions Trading Association
membership: IETA has formed several partnerships including, among others, the World Bank, Eurelectric, the World Business Council for Sustainable Development (WBCSD) and the California Climate Action Registry, the Edison Electric Institute (EEI), the Electric Power Research Institute (EPRI), Carbon Market Institute (CMI) and the San Francisco Carbon Collaborative.
memberOrga: The list of IETA's member companies is available at: http://www.ieta.org/our-members
goal:
IETA is dedicated to:

- the objectives of the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) and ultimately climate protection;
- the establishment of effective market-based trading systems for greenhouse gas emissions by businesses that are demonstrably fair, open, efficient, accountable and consistent across national boundaries;
- maintaining societal equity and environmental integrity while establishing these systems.

Goals and Objectives

IETA works for:

- the development of an active, global greenhouse gas market, consistent across national boundaries and involving all flexibility mechanisms: the Clean Development Mechanism, Joint Implementation, the implementation of Article 6 of the Paris Agreement and emissions trading;
- the creation of systems and instruments that will ensure effective business participation.

To be the premier voice for the business community on emissions trading, the objectives for the organization are to:

- promote an integrated view of the emissions trading system as a solution to climate change;
- participate in the design and implementation of national and international rules and guidelines;
- provide the most up-to-date and credible source of information on emissions trading and greenhouse gas market activity.


Work Programme

To achieve its goals, IETA will focus on the following areas:

- Develop components of the GHG market and trading systems. IETA has established a number of Working Groups that meet regularly and organise events on topics like emissions trading, technical aspects of carbon markets, registry accounts and monitoring, reporting and verification (MRV).
IETA continues to map down initiatives that work in developing components of the carbon markets and help create an effective and well functioning carbon market.
- Promote market mechanisms and participation in carbon markets. IETA continues to promote market mechanisms and trading as the solution to the business community to minimize costs effectively.
- Development of a global carbon market. A critical element in IETA's work remains the linking of trading regimes among Annex I countires, and its significance for the GHG market.
- Capacity Building, by developing and delivering courses on carbon markets, the effective functioning of an emissions trading system and the monitoring, reporting and verification (MRV) component.
euInitiatives:
- EU ETS Phase 4 implementation (i.a. the review of the Auctioning Regulation; free allocation adjustments due to changes in production levels; State Aid Guidelines for Compensation for the Indirect Costs)
- Impact of Brexit on the functioning of the EU ETS
- EU's long term decarbonisation strategy
- Aviation under the EU ETS and the work of the EU and CORSIA
- EU's NDC and participation in international climate negotiations with a special focus on the implementation of Article 6 of the Paris Agreement
